KeyboardHandler Class Reference

#include <KeyboardHandler.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The keyboard input handler handles input events produced by the keyboard connected to this computer.

The update method is called by the input manager, and the input handler increases events by calling the input manager's increaseEventQuantity method.

Author:
Thomas Jacob

bool increaseManagerEventQuantities (  int  scanCode,
bool  held,
bool  pressed,
bool  released,
int  repeats
) 
 

Notifies the input manager about keyboard events not consumed by any event targets.

These events cause input manager's event quantities to increase. Do not call this method directly, it is called by the respective input event.

Parameters:
scanCode The scan code of the key that caused the event.
held Whether the key is currently held down.
pressed Whether the key is newly pressed down.
released Whether the key has been released.
repeats The number of key repeats.
Returns:
Whether any attached event matches the given parameters.

Note:
Override but supercall this method in the platform implementation.

char lastFrameKeyHelds[256] [protected]
 

An array containing zeros and ones.

One indicates that the respective key has been held down the last frame.
